<Highlander1969> For those interested, the L2 Standards WG will be discussing tomorrow (6/26 at 7 am PT / 10 am ET / 16:0]0GMT /17:00 CET / 6:30 pm IST ) the L2 Transaction Fee API spec PR (https://github.com/ethereum-oasis-op/L2/pull/53). In particular L2 tx statuses and their drfinitions. 

Meeting zoom link is here:
https://us02web.zoom.us/j/81599021689?pwd=VmxPVUNCVmE5RkkweGY1YmN1OWMrZz09 (re @eliastzr: I think wallets and block explorers should be able to convey similar levels of heuristics about a tx status (though block explorers display a lot more info)

Every rollup has on their block explorer some notion of soft finality vs. strong finality 

Maybe we could unite into an RIP and name those 3 to 4 states a tx goes through so wallets accurately help users navigate this security space (could simply end up being the color of the âœ…)
Same for etherjs and similar tools that rely on logic such as block mining to confirm a tx 
(this also paves the way for supporting preconfs on L1))
